channel.title: NYT > World
channel.copyright: Copyright 2014 The New York Times Company

item.title: Despite Israeli Push in Gaza, Hamas Fighters Slip Through Tunnels
item.description: Even as Israeli forces moved to demolish militants’ tunnels into Israel, several Hamas fighters slipped through passages on Saturday and fought gun battles with Israeli soldiers.
item.dc:creator: By ANNE BARNARD and JODI RUDOREN
item.media:description: Israeli troops fired toward the Gaza Strip from their position near the border on Saturday. Israeli strikes killed 20 people in Gaza, pushing the death toll above 300.

item.title: Attack Kills at Least 21 Egyptian Soldiers at Checkpoint in Western Desert
item.description: A military official said about 20 gunmen in weapon-mounted vehicles took a checkpoint by surprise in Egypt’s western desert, killing at least 20 soldiers.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By KAREEM FAHIM

item.title: Palestinians Find Show of Support Lacking From Arab Leaders Amid Offensive
item.description: The governments were accused of dithering at critical moments, and at one point, Egypt even blamed Hamas, rather than Israel, for dozens of Palestinian deaths.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By KAREEM FAHIM
item.media:description: Relatives transported the bodies of the Abu Jarad family to a cemetery in Gaza City on Saturday.

item.title: With Jet Strike, War in Ukraine Is Felt Globally
item.description: The downing of Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 rippled across multiple continents, bringing home in vivid relief the consequences of a struggle that had seemed far removed for many.
item.dc:creator: By PETER BAKER
item.media:description: Emergency workers on Saturday carried a body from the site of the Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 crash in the Donetsk region. For many, the disaster brought home a struggle that had seemed distant.

item.title: In Remote Corners of India, Immunity for Soldiers Who Kill and Rape Civilians
item.description: In remote areas like Kashmir, and Manipur State, a colonial-era immunity law continues to embolden soldiers and police officers there to commit crimes without bothering to cover them up.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: By GARDINER HARRIS
item.media:description: Security personnel patrol in Manipur State in northeast India. A colonial-era immunity law emboldens the police officers there to commit crimes.

item.title: On Southern Border, Mexico Faces Crisis of Its Own
item.description: Mexico has announced plans for tightened deportation and border control policies as its migrant numbers surge in response to worsening gang violence in Central America.
item.dc:creator: By RANDAL C. ARCHIBOLD

item.title: Thousands in India Demand Justice for Girl, 6, Who Was Raped at School
item.description: More than 4,000 parents and relatives of children who attend a school where a 6-year-old girl was raped in Bangalore, India, demanded that the police arrest those involved.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: 5 Bombs Explode in Baghdad as Dispute Continues With Jordan
item.description: The dispute centered on a meeting held in Amman, the Jordanian capital, by 11 Iraqi Sunni groups, including some that are actively fighting the Iraqi government.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By ALISSA J. RUBIN
item.media:description: The site of a bombing in the Jihad neighborhood of Baghdad, one of several attacks that killed dozens across the city, on Saturday.

item.title: With Jet’s Fall, War in Ukraine Is Felt Globally
item.description: The downing of Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 rippled across multiple continents, bringing home in vivid relief the consequences of a struggle that had seemed far removed for many.
item.dc:creator: By PETER BAKER
item.media:description: Emergency workers on Saturday carried a body from the site of the Malaysia Airlines Flight 17 crash in the Donetsk region. For many, the disaster brought home a struggle that had seemed distant.

item.title: Russia Expands List of Barred Americans
item.description: The announcement followed a round of sanctions imposed Wednesday by Washington against Russian companies and individuals, the third such measure this year.
item.dc:creator: By NEIL MacFARQUHAR

item.title: News Analysis: Staying the Course on Iran by Threatening Pain and Offering Relief
item.description: Behind President Obama’s decision to extend the Iran nuclear negotiations is a calculation that the administration has the mix of pressure and incentives just about right.
item.dc:creator: By DAVID E. SANGER
item.media:description: Iran’s foreign minister, Mohammad Javad Zarif, says his country must produce nuclear fuel for reasons of national security.

item.title: Ukraine Says It Can Prove Russia Supplied Arms System That Felled Jet
item.description: The Ukrainian government said it had proof that Russia had provided the surface-to-air missile system that shot down a Malaysia Airlines passenger jet, killing all 298 people aboard.
item.dc:creator: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN

item.title: Struggling to Keep Afghan Girl Safe After a Mullah Is Accused of Rape
item.description: Support for the rape suspect — a mullah — and plans by the girl’s family for an “honor killing” have become emblematic of a broader failure to help female Afghan victims.
item.dc:creator: By ROD NORDLAND
item.media:credit: Bryan Denton for The New York Times
item.media:description: Dr. Hassina Sarwari, the head of Women for Afghan Women, showed photos of a girl who reported being raped by a mullah.

item.title: U.S. Drone Kills 15 Militants in Pakistan
item.description: The strike was the fourth reported in the North Waziristan tribal region since Pakistan began a military operation there last month.
item.dc:creator: By ISMAIL KHAN

item.title: Karlijn Keijzer and Quinn Schansman Were Aboard Malaysia Airlines Flight 17
item.description: Karlijn Keijzer, 25, and Quinn Schansman, 19, were on their way to vacations when the Malaysia Airlines jet was brought down.
item.dc:creator: By DAVID MONTGOMERY and IAN LOVETT

item.title: Downing of Jet Exposes Defects of Flight Precautions Over Ukraine
item.description: Flight restrictions underestimated the risks to a startling degree, leaving Flight 17 exposed at 33,000 feet to missiles known to fly to more than twice that height.
item.dc:creator: By KEITH BRADSHER, C. J. CHIVERS and NICOLA CLARK
item.media:description: Liow Tiong Lai, Malaysia’s transport minister, said that the aircraft shot down over Ukraine had been following a safe route.

item.title: Hamas Tunnels Prompted Invasion of Gaza
item.description: Gaza militants have long used tunnels to attack Israel. A recent incursion led to the discovery of dozens, the Israeli military said.
item.dc:creator: By ISABEL KERSHNER
item.media:credit: Israeli Defense Forces, via European Pressphoto Agency
item.media:description: The Israeli military displayed weapons near Sufa where it said it destroyed a tunnel that militants used to enter the country.

item.title: Conviction of Berlusconi in Sex Case Is Overturned
item.description: An appeals court acquitted the former Italian prime minister of paying for sex with a minor and revoked his seven-year sentence and ban from public office.
item.dc:creator: By ELISABETTA POVOLEDO
item.media:description: The former Italian prime minister, Silvio Berlusconi, on Friday.

item.title: Negotiators Agree to Extend Iran Nuclear Talks Four More Months, Diplomats Say
item.description: Iran, the United States and five other countries agreed to a four-month extension as they try to bridge a divide over whether Iran must dismantle parts of its nuclear program, officials said.
item.dc:creator: By DAVID E. SANGER

item.title: World Briefing: Argentina: Pope Calls for Justice
item.description: Pope Francis called for justice to be served in the deadly bombing of a Jewish community center in Buenos Aires 20 years ago that local courts have blamed on Iran.
item.dc:creator: By REUTERS

item.title: Fleeing Amid Airstrikes, Gazans Find Few Places to Be Safe
item.description: For civilians in the Gaza Strip, the hardships of war include a lack of electricity and clean water.
item.dc:creator: By ANNE BARNARD
item.media:description: An Israeli bomb exploded in Gaza City Friday evening, less than 24 hours after Israeli tanks rolled into the northern Gaza Strip.

item.title: Quick History: A Week of Agony, From Eastern Ukraine to the Gaza Strip
item.description: There are times when the endless crises and conflicts of our times reach such paroxysms of senseless tragedy that the world cries out for a halt.
item.dc:creator: By SERGE SCHMEMANN
item.media:description: Tanks maneuvered outside the northern Gaza Strip on Friday, as Israel intensified its land offensive against Hamas, with artillery, tanks and gunboats.

item.title: With Grief on Top of Grief, Malaysians Are Tested on Flight 370’s Lessons
item.description: Anger over Malaysia Airline’s decision to fly the Ukraine route could prove a new challenge for the government four months after another plane operated by the carrier disappeared.
item.dc:creator: By CHRIS BUCKLEY
item.media:description: Women at Kuala Lumpur International Airport on Friday mourning a relative who was among the 298 passengers and crew aboard Malaysia Airlines Flight 17.

item.title: Rebels in Ukraine Crowed of Past Attacks, but Deny This One
item.description: As investigators look into who shot down a Malaysia Airlines jet, the rebels in Ukraine have been using increasingly powerful weapons against hard-to-reach targets.
item.dc:creator: By SABRINA TAVERNISE and DAVID M. HERSZENHORN
item.media:description: Alexander Borodai, a separatist official, center, at a site where the airliner came down. He says the rebels do not have the technical means to have shot it down.

item.title: A Mother Asks Obama: ‘Please Remember My Amir’
item.description: The letter from Behnaz Hekmati, the mother of Amir Hekmati, appeared timed to convey the family’s wish that the United States use its leverage in the talks to win his release.
item.dc:creator: By RICK GLADSTONE
